poem:
**Ode to Skype's Farewell**

A blue-lit bridge,  
once spanning worlds—  
now silent, whispered into  
the clatter of Teams,  
where faces blur in lifeless squares,  
no longer boundless.  
Yet still, in fading echoes,  
the memory of voices persists—  
a digital breath,  
a spark in the ether,  
gone beyond words.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Skype got shouted down by Teams and Zoom. But it revolutionised human connection | John Naughton So Microsoft has decided to terminate Skype, the internet telephony company it bought in 2011 for $8.5bn (£6.6bn). Its millions of hapless users are to be herded into Microsoft Teams, a virtual encampment with a brain-dead aesthetic that makes even Zoom look cool. This eventuality had been telegraphed for quite a while but, even so, it comes as a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
